title: Flipped Learning and Simulation-Based Training Program to Strengthen Ethical Competencies of Medical Educators

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical education experience and practical elementary language instruction experience
context.additional_context: Delivering an ethics framework applicable to medical education settings for practicing elementary language educators through flipped learning and mobile-optimized simulations

learning_goals: In medical education contexts, learners can apply the principle of respecting learner autonomy to practical cases with over 85% accuracy
Learners successfully achieve non-maleficence-based decision-making in ethical dilemma simulations across three consecutive performance assessments through simulation-based learning
Learners demonstrate competency in developing and utilizing flipped learning materials for equity implementation in educational environments, evidenced through learning journal assessments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
